a.xlink:title: class CrisisManagementSystem BcmsCore.ump Core Umple model file for the Crisis management system Source document: http://cserg0.site.uottawa.ca/cma2012/CaseStudy.pdf Author: Timothy C. Lethbridge To use this, a master file must be created with use statements that link in RoutesAndLocations.ump and CoordinationStateMachine.ump Plus provide multiplicities as described. * The singleton that will link to the various * system elements Note that variants with different multiplicities will associate this with crises and coordinators
class Crisis * A crisis is what is being managed by the Crisis Management System
String identifier
Location gpsLocation
Time initialReportedTime
String description
class Vehicle Police or fire vehicle From Requirements section 8 Data Dictionary
String vehicleID
Location currentLocation
Time eta
Location intendedLocation
Boolean brokenDown
Boolean inTrafficCongestion

Crisis 0..1 -> * assignedFireVehicles Vehicle
A Vehicle called assignedFireVehicles may have a Crisis. It can have none or just 1.
A Crisis has some Vehicles called assignedFireVehicles. It can have none, and there is no upper bound defined.

Crisis 0..1 -> * assignedFireVehicles Vehicle
A Vehicle called assignedFireVehicles may have a Crisis. It can have none or just 1.
A Crisis has some Vehicles called assignedFireVehicles. It can have none, and there is no upper bound defined.

Crisis 0..1 -> * assignedFireVehicles Vehicle
A Vehicle called assignedFireVehicles may have a Crisis. It can have none or just 1.
A Crisis has some Vehicles called assignedFireVehicles. It can have none, and there is no upper bound defined.

Crisis 0..1 -> * assignedPoliceVehicles Vehicle
A Vehicle called assignedPoliceVehicles may have a Crisis. It can have none or just 1.
A Crisis has some Vehicles called assignedPoliceVehicles. It can have none, and there is no upper bound defined.

Crisis 0..1 -> * assignedPoliceVehicles Vehicle
A Vehicle called assignedPoliceVehicles may have a Crisis. It can have none or just 1.
A Crisis has some Vehicles called assignedPoliceVehicles. It can have none, and there is no upper bound defined.

Crisis 0..1 -> * assignedPoliceVehicles Vehicle
A Vehicle called assignedPoliceVehicles may have a Crisis. It can have none or just 1.
A Crisis has some Vehicles called assignedPoliceVehicles. It can have none, and there is no upper bound defined.
class RoadSegment Classes defined elsewhere

Crisis 0..1 -> * blockedOrCongestedSegments RoadSegment
A RoadSegment called blockedOrCongestedSegments may have a Crisis. It can have none or just 1.
A Crisis has some RoadSegments called blockedOrCongestedSegments. It can have none, and there is no upper bound defined.

A RoadSegment called blockedOrCongestedSegments may have a Crisis. It can have none or just 1.
A Crisis has some RoadSegments called blockedOrCongestedSegments. It can have none, and there is no upper bound defined.

Crisis 0..1 -> * blockedOrCongestedSegments RoadSegment
A RoadSegment called blockedOrCongestedSegments may have a Crisis. It can have none or just 1.
A Crisis has some RoadSegments called blockedOrCongestedSegments. It can have none, and there is no upper bound defined.
class Route

Crisis 0..1 -> 0..1 proposedFireRoute Route
A Route called proposedFireRoute may have a Crisis. It can have none or just 1.
A Crisis may have a Route called proposedFireRoute. It can have none or just 1.

Crisis 0..1 -> 0..1 proposedFireRoute Route
A Route called proposedFireRoute may have a Crisis. It can have none or just 1.
A Crisis may have a Route called proposedFireRoute. It can have none or just 1.

Crisis 0..1 -> 0..1 proposedFireRoute Route
A Route called proposedFireRoute may have a Crisis. It can have none or just 1.
A Crisis may have a Route called proposedFireRoute. It can have none or just 1.

Crisis 0..1 -> 0..1 proposedPoliceRoute Route
A Route called proposedPoliceRoute may have a Crisis. It can have none or just 1.
A Crisis may have a Route called proposedPoliceRoute. It can have none or just 1.

Crisis 0..1 -> 0..1 proposedPoliceRoute Route
A Route called proposedPoliceRoute may have a Crisis. It can have none or just 1.
A Crisis may have a Route called proposedPoliceRoute. It can have none or just 1.

Crisis 0..1 -> 0..1 proposedPoliceRoute Route
A Route called proposedPoliceRoute may have a Crisis. It can have none or just 1.
A Crisis may have a Route called proposedPoliceRoute. It can have none or just 1.

Crisis 0..1 -> * disagreedRoutes Route
A Route called disagreedRoutes may have a Crisis. It can have none or just 1.
A Crisis has some Routes called disagreedRoutes. It can have none, and there is no upper bound defined.

Crisis 0..1 -> * disagreedRoutes Route
A Route called disagreedRoutes may have a Crisis. It can have none or just 1.
A Crisis has some Routes called disagreedRoutes. It can have none, and there is no upper bound defined.

A Route called disagreedRoutes may have a Crisis. It can have none or just 1.
A Crisis has some Routes called disagreedRoutes. It can have none, and there is no upper bound defined.

Vehicle 0..1 -- 0..1 routePlan Route
A Route called routePlan may have a Vehicle. It can have none or just 1.
A Vehicle may have a Route called routePlan. It can have none or just 1.

Vehicle 0..1 -- 0..1 routePlan Route
A Route called routePlan may have a Vehicle. It can have none or just 1.
A Vehicle may have a Route called routePlan. It can have none or just 1.

Vehicle 0..1 -- 0..1 routePlan Route
A Route called routePlan may have a Vehicle. It can have none or just 1.
A Vehicle may have a Route called routePlan. It can have none or just 1.

class StationCoordinator * The station coordinator is the automated agent of the Human coordinator in either the fire service (FSC) or police service (PSC). Any running version of this program will just have one of these active as the current coordinator and one or more active as remote coordinators to communicate with
String identification
Boolean police false for fire
